ngiemboon: Ndavîd la fó jʉʼó ńkÿo ńgʉa ńdyeen tsɛ̀ɛ mvwɔ̀ʼ gie ée Andulam. Mefɛ̌ pé lâ tsìŋendá yé ntsèm la zsé púʼu, ńcwóŋ ńgʉa ńkẅɛ́te yé wó.
en: So David left Gath and took refuge in the cave of Adullam.   When David’s brothers and his father’s whole family heard, they went down and joined him there.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm pie nò la ne ńcʉa wɔ́b, e pie é la gẅiin njǔ, mbɔɔ pie nò la ne ńgyáŋa wɔ́b, pú ńcúʼte lejʉ́ŋ yé, á leen ńké ńcʉ́ʼʉ tándá wɔb. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ laa nzèm yé tà ńgwɔ́ mmó nkÿo lekùɔ.
en: In addition, every man who was desperate, in debt, or discontented rallied around him, and he became their leader. About four hundred men were with him.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la fó jʉʼó ńgʉa ne tÿǒsoŋ Misepe gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Mowab. Ńgɔɔn mbwó fùɔ Mowab ngie: Tsétsɔʼ, zẅíŋe ngie tá wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ má wɔ̀ɔn kÿo ńtó ńnéŋe láʼ gù, ńdɔg ńzẅíʼte fʉ̀ʼ gie n ge gyá mmó gie Ssé ge gÿo na mèŋ.
en: From there David went to Mizpeh of Moab where he said to the king of Moab, “Please let my father and mother stay with you until I know what God will do for me.”

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la leen ńké ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa né nɔʼɔ fùɔ Mowab, pâ pɔ̌ láʼ ńnéŋe wó na nzẅìŋ mefʉ̀ʼ mie Ndavîd la tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ lelyěen.
en: So he left them in the care of the king of Moab, and they stayed with him the whole time David was in the stronghold.

ngiemboon: Ngâd gẅie aa ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn mbwó Ndavîd ngie: Te gíŋe ńtsẅé jʉʼʉ lelyěen; Lu ssé ḿbiŋ ne tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Yúndà. Ndavîd leen ńké ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ mbím gie ee Elɛd.
en: Then the prophet Gad   said to David, “Don’t stay in the stronghold. Leave and return to the land of Judah.” So David left and went to the forest of Hereth.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ gÿo ńgwɔ́ Saẅi gʉa lekwɔʼɔ́ Ngimbeya, ńnéŋe tsìŋe tsɔ́ tÿǒ gie mé tóŋo lê tamalísè ńkúʼte lekwoŋ sé pwó, menkwɔɔn pé pú ńtyéte lejʉ́ŋ yé. Saẅi júʼ ngie mé zsé jʉʼ gie Ndavîd pâ pʉ̀a pé ée wó.
en: Saul heard that David and his men had been discovered. At that time Saul was in Gibeah, sitting under the tamarisk tree   at the high place. His spear was in his hand, and all his servants were standing around him.

ngiemboon: Saẅi gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi cwoŋo ńjúʼ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, pi pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ ndá Mbeŋjÿameŋ! Pi kwǎŋ ngie míŋ Yesêe ŋwɛ́ ge gÿo ná menkáʼ mbɔɔ menkáʼ metÿǒ melùʼ né pi metsèm keen? Pi kwǎŋ ngie à ge gÿo lɔgɔ gẅí metsèm, é gÿo mefùɔ pasáʼ palÿɔ́ʼncù ntsáʼ, mbɔɔ pasáʼ palÿɔ́ʼncù nkÿo keen?
en: Saul said to his servants, “Listen, men of Benjamin: Is Jesse’s son going to give all of you fields and vineyards? Do you think he’ll make all of you commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds?

ngiemboon: Tà ńtí kɔ́ pi metsèm pú ńgúu ncù wɔ́ɔn? Alagá nyìŋ kaa kága tuŋó yɔ́ɔn páʼ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ Ndavîd míŋ Yesêe gwaa kʉ̀a wɔ́. Alagá nyìŋ kaa mÿɔg ńtí yɔ́ɔn twó wɔ́. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ kě te ŋéʼe tà shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn ngie míŋ wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkẅiŋte mbàŋa awɛ̌ ngie à nuŋe nzòŋ lélɔg ḿbíi wɔ́ɔn, páʼ á kẅɛ̌ púʼu lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn lɔɔn wɔ́.
en: That’s why all of you have conspired against me! Nobody tells me when my own son makes a covenant with Jesse’s son.   None of you cares about me  # 22:8 1Sm 23:21 or tells me that my son has stirred up my own servant to wait in ambush for me, as is the case today.”

ngiemboon: Ndoyɛg, nyìŋ Éndɔ̀m gẅie à la tyé na nùɔ pʉ̀a pe Saẅi, tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Mèŋ n da gyá páʼ míŋ Yesêe gee né Nɔb, á mbʉ̀a Ahimelɛg gẅie aa míŋ Ayitub.
en: Then Doeg the Edomite,   who was in charge of Saul’s servants, answered, “I saw Jesse’s son come to Ahimelech son of Ahitub at Nob.  # 22:9 1Sm 21:1; Ps 52 title

ngiemboon: Ahimelɛg zɛ́te nò yé mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; ńná shúm léjÿó né yé, ńná nně ncù Ngoliyad nyìŋ Filisi né yé.
en: Ahimelech inquired of the Lord for him   and gave him provisions.  # 22:10 1Sm 21:6,9 He also gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.”  # 22:10 1Sm 21:2–9

ngiemboon: Afùɔ gÿo mé tóŋo Ahimelɛg, míŋ Ayitub gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ, pâ yé tsìŋendá ntsèm gie á laa Nɔb, ńgwɔ́ panuŋepwɔʼ, pɔ́ cúʼte lejʉ́ŋ fùɔ.
en: The king sent messengers to summon the priest Ahimelech son of Ahitub, and his father’s whole family, who were priests in Nob. All of them came to the king.

ngiemboon: Saẅi gɔɔn ngie: Ngie mbà míŋ Ayitub! Á zẅíŋ ngie mé jǔʼ mbà loo!
en: Then Saul said, “Listen, son of Ahitub! ”

ngiemboon: Saẅi zɛ́te yé ngie: Mélàʼakɔ́ pi míŋ Yesêe ka lɔ́ɔn ncù wɔ́ɔn? Mélàʼakɔ́ ɔ̀ ka na shùm léjÿó né yé? Ńná nně ncù né yé, ḿbiŋ ńtóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a na sé lezíŋ, lélɔg ńtẅɛ́te yé ńnéŋe nzèm mèŋ, ńnuŋe nzòŋ ńdɔg ḿbíi wɔ́ɔn? Páʼ á kẅɛ̌ púʼu lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn lɔɔn.
en: Saul asked him, “Why did you and Jesse’s son conspire against me? You gave him bread and a sword and inquired of God for him, so he could rise up against me and wait in ambush, as is the case today.”

ngiemboon: Ahimelɛg tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó fùɔ ngie: Awɔ̌ aa na megàŋafàʼ pú metsèm gẅie ńgwɔ́ mé ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ yé páʼ Ndavîd loo? Á yé gẅie à la zɔ́ʼɔ míŋ fùɔ, á yé gẅie aa kwaʼ ngàŋa liŋé na papyɛ́bɛ gú, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie mekěm pú ná mekùʼ mé tɛʼ.
en: Ahimelech replied to the king, “Who among all your servants is as faithful as David?   He is the king’s son-in-law, captain of your bodyguard, and honored in your house.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn gie n tóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a na twó yé ka? Ngǎŋ mbà loo! Ḿbɔ́ɔn fùɔ lézába yɛ̌ pìʼ twó mèŋ, tà mbɔɔ na tsìŋendá yɔ́ɔn, mélàʼmie n te nò na menò mɛ̂ zsé.
en: Was today the first time I inquired of God for him?   Of course not! Please don’t let the king make an accusation against your servant or any of my father’s family, for your servant didn’t have any idea  # 22:15 Lit didn’t know a thing, small or large about all this.”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ gɔɔn ngie: Ahimelɛg, pi lâ tsìŋendá jú ntsèm ge kwéte!
en: But the king said, “You will die, Ahimelech #— #you and your father’s whole family! ”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó palÿɔ́ʼncù pie é la ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ yé ngie: Pi gʉa ńzẅéte panuŋepwɔʼ pe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Kwàʼ pɔ́b yɔ́b ka kẅéte Ndavîd. Pɔ́ ka ne ńzsé ngie Ndavîd ne ńkÿo, ńké te wɔ́ɔn shwóŋ. Táʼ palÿɔ́ʼncù fùɔ la te kwoŋo lézẅéte panuŋepwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: Then the king ordered the guards standing by him, “Turn and kill the priests of the Lord    because they sided with David. For they knew he was fleeing, but they didn’t tell me.” But the king’s servants would not lift a hand to execute the priests of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, afùɔ gɔɔn né Ndoyɛg ngie: Kwaʼ gù, gʉa ńzẅéte panuŋepwɔʼ. Ndoyɛg nyìŋ Éndɔ̀m leen ńké ńgʉa, yé zɔ̌ zẅéte panuŋepwɔʼ. À la zẅéte pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b tʉ̂a lé móm lefɔ̌ɔn lyɛʼó pie é la maʼa efɔd gẅie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sìsyè ḿbáʼ.
en: So the king said to Doeg, “Go and execute the priests! ” So Doeg the Edomite went and executed the priests himself. On that day, he killed eighty-five men   who wore linen ephods.  # 22:18 Ex 28:4; 1Sm 2:28

ngiemboon: À la lɔg nně ncù ńgʉa Nɔb, á tÿǒsoŋ gie panuŋepwɔʼ ée wó; ńzẅéte mbàŋa lâ panzwě, ńzẅéte penkʉ́ lâ púɔ mepÿɛ́, ńzẅé mefòŋ lâ menzikáasè, tà mbɔɔ menjʉ̀njÿò lâ mvfó.
en: He also struck down Nob, the city of the priests, with the sword #— #both men and women, infants and nursing babies, oxen, donkeys, and sheep.

ngiemboon: Ndàʼ Ambiyataa míŋ Ahimelɛg gẅie aa míŋ Ayitub zɔ la vwɔʼɔ. À la kÿo ńgʉa ńkẅɛ́te Ndavîd.
en: However, one of the sons of Ahimelech son of Ahitub escaped. His name was Abiathar,   and he fled to David.  # 22:20 1Sm 2:33

ngiemboon: Ambiyataa la shwóŋo Ndavîd páʼ Saẅi ka zẅéte panuŋepwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Abiathar told David that Saul had killed the priests of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd gɔɔn né Ambiyataa ngie: N daa lyɛʼó ŋwɛ́ ńcwoŋo ńjúʼ páʼ Ndoyɛg nyìŋ Éndɔ̀m gẅie à laa yé ssé la te nyé té pú ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ shwóŋo Saẅi wɔ́. Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie mèŋ zɔ ka gÿo tá pʉ̀a tsìŋendá jú ntsèm kwéte.
en: Then David said to Abiathar, “I knew that Doeg the Edomite   was there that day and that he was sure to report to Saul. I myself am responsible for  # 22:22 LXX, Syr, Vg; MT reads I myself turn in the lives of everyone in your father’s family.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ɔn lépɔ́g, pɔ̀gɔ néŋe jʉʼɔɔn, mélàʼmie nyìŋ gẅie à faʼa lézẅé wɔ́ɔn, à giŋé ne faʼa lézẅé gú jú. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ge júʼ mboŋó.
en: Stay with me. Don’t be afraid, for the one who wants to take my life wants to take your life.   You will be safe with me.”
